newsitem.title: USA: El Paso says second N.M. gas line repaired.
newsitem.headline: El Paso says second N.M. gas line repaired.

text.p: El Paso Natural Gas Co said the second of two New Mexico natural gas pipelines damaged last Tuesday was repaired Friday, restoring another 70 million cubic feet per day (mmcfd) of capacity cut by the incident.
A 30-inch pipeline failure last Tuesday about 30 miles north of Roswell, N.M., affected two parallel lines and cut about 550 mmcfd of capacity.
Repairs to one of the damaged lines Thursday returned the Permian-San Juan Crossover system to service and restored about 480 mmcfd.
El Paso Natural Gas is the transmission subsidiary of El Paso Energy Corp.
